p: The different amounts of glucose resulted in a different yield of A. melanogenum cells. The counting chamber measurements performed on the glucose suspensions showed an increase in total cell concentration in the first days of incubation. The suspensions with an initial amount of 1% glucose had a final median of 1.3 × 10 8 cells/ml (95% confidence interval = [1.2 × 10 8, 1.5 × 10 8]) that included the total cell concentration at days 4, 5, and 6. The measurements of the 0.2% glucose suspensions showed already a similar total cell concentrations from day 1 onwards (days 1, 1.5, 4, 5, and 6), resulting in a median final total cell concentration of 1.9 × 10 7 cells/ml (95% confidence interval = [1.7 × 10 7; 2.1 × 10 7]). Results of the ANOVA test showed that these medians were significantly different ( p < 0.001).
